metadata.title: CVE-2019-9456 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In the Android kernel in Pixel C USB monitor driver there is a possible OOBwrite due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is notneeded for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1026-kvm - 4.4.0-1026.31
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1060-aws - 4.4.0-1060.69
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1031-aws - 4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-127.153').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1026.31').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.69').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.98').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1093.98').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
